FuncDef:
The classifier behavior command binds a traffic behavior to a traffic classifier in a traffic policy.
The undo classifier behavior command unbinds a traffic behavior from a traffic classifier in a traffic policy. The classifier behavior command binds a traffic behavior to a traffic classifier in a traffic policy. The undo classifier behavior command unbinds a traffic behavior from a traffic classifier in a traffic policy. By default, no traffic classifier or traffic behavior is bound to a traffic policy.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a traffic classifier.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, starting with a letter or digit. It cannot contain spaces or question marks (?).

Specifies the name of a traffic behavior.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, starting with a letter or digit. It cannot contain spaces or question marks (?).

Specifies the priority of a traffic classifier.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

ExtraInfo: To take an action for packets of a certain type, use a traffic classifier to group the packets into one class and use a traffic behavior to define an action. Then associate the traffic classifier with the traffic behavior and bind them to a traffic policy.
